  • Analysis utilities

Analysis utilities#

circle_bundles.analysis.fiberwise_clustering.fiberwise_clustering(data, U, eps_values, min_sample_values, *, build_pca_embeddings=True, pca_dim=2)[source]#

Fiberwise DBSCAN clustering, then a global cluster-graph built from overlaps.

Parameters:

  • data ((n_samples, d))

  • U ((n_fibers, n_samples) bool)

  • eps_values ((n_fibers,) float)

  • min_sample_values ((n_fibers,) int)

  • build_pca_embeddings (bool)

  • pca_dim (int)

Returns:

  • components ((n_samples,) int) – Global component label per sample (based on connected components of the cluster-graph). Unassigned samples remain -1.

  • G (nx.Graph) – Nodes are (fiber_idx, cluster_label) with attribute ‘indices’ (sample indices). Edges indicate overlap; includes ‘indices_shared’.

  • graph_dict (dict) – Simple serialization-friendly summary.

  • cl ((n_fibers, n_samples) int) – DBSCAN labels within each fiber (-1 noise).

  • summary (dict) – Useful arrays and optional PCA embeddings for plotting.

circle_bundles.analysis.fiberwise_clustering.get_cluster_persistence(G, *, show_results=True, save_path=None)[source]#

Track number of connected components as we remove edges by nondecreasing weight.

Requires that G edges have ‘weight’ (e.g. computed by get_weights()).

Returns a list of dicts:

{‘weight’: w, ‘n_components’: int, ‘components’: [set(nodes), …]}

Parameters:

  • show_results (bool)

  • save_path (str | None)

circle_bundles.analysis.fiberwise_clustering.get_filtered_cluster_graph(data, G, cl, *, thresh, rule='to_smaller_cluster', show_results=True, hide_biggest=False, save_path=None)[source]#

Threshold the weighted cluster graph, separate intersections for removed edges, and recompute global components.

Requires that G edges have ‘weight’ (e.g. computed by get_weights()).

Returns:

  • components_filtered ((n_samples,) int)

  • filtered_G (nx.Graph)

  • graph_dict_filtered (dict)

  • cl_clean ((n_fibers, n_samples) int)

  • comp_inds ((n_components, n_samples) bool)

Parameters:

  • data (ndarray)

  • cl (ndarray)

  • thresh (float)

  • rule (str)

  • show_results (bool)

  • hide_biggest (bool)

  • save_path (str | None)

circle_bundles.analysis.fiberwise_clustering.plot_fiberwise_pca_grid(summary, *, to_view=None, cmap='viridis', point_size=5.0, n_cols=4, save_path=None)[source]#

Plot PCA scatter for selected fibers using summary[‘pca_store’]. Requires fiberwise_clustering(…, build_pca_embeddings=True).

Parameters:

  • to_view (Sequence[int] | None)

  • cmap (str)

  • point_size (float)

  • n_cols (int)

  • save_path (str | None)

circle_bundles.analysis.local_analysis.get_local_pca(data, U, p_values=None, to_view=None, n_components=2, random_state=None)[source]#

Local PCA on each fiber (after optional subsampling).

Returns:

  • fiber_ids (list[int])

  • idx_list (list[np.ndarray] indices used in each fiber)

  • proj_list (list[np.ndarray | None] PCA projections (m_i, n_components) or None)

Parameters:

  • data (ndarray)

  • U (ndarray)

  • p_values (ndarray | Sequence[float] | None)

  • to_view (Sequence[int] | None)

  • n_components (int)

  • random_state (int | None)

Return type:

tuple[list[int], list[ndarray], list[ndarray | None]]

circle_bundles.analysis.local_analysis.plot_local_pca(fiber_ids, proj_list, *, n_cols=4, titles='default', font_size=16, point_size=10.0, save_path=None)[source]#

circle_bundles.analysis.local_analysis.get_local_rips(data, U, p_values=None, to_view=None, *, maxdim=0, n_perm=500, random_state=None, **ripser_kwargs)[source]#

Run Ripser on each fiber after optional subsampling.

Notes

Imports ripser lazily so importing this module doesn’t require ripser.

Parameters:

  • data (ndarray)

  • U (ndarray)

  • p_values (ndarray | Sequence[float] | None)

  • to_view (Sequence[int] | None)

  • maxdim (int)

  • n_perm (int)

  • random_state (int | None)

Return type:

tuple[list[int], list[ndarray], list[dict | None]]
